message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.MM 

The paper deals with zero-shot learning for visual recognition, which is a problem in computer vision. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also proposes a framework that involves supervised subspace learning and semi-supervised Sammon mapping, which are techniques used in machine learning and artificial intelligence. Hence, cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also likely categories. The paper also deals with the semantic gap between visual features and their underlying semantics, which is a problem in natural language processing. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is another possible category. Finally, the paper evaluates its proposed approach on benchmark datasets, which is a common practice in multimedia research. Hence, cs.MM (Multimedia) is another possible category.
